content: I can't predict the future. however, many cities around the world are already taking initiatives to increase the use of renewable energy. examples include copenhagen's plan to carbon neutrality by 2025, san francisco's commitment to 100% renewable energy by 2030, and sydney's aim to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 70% by 2030. the benefits of renewable energy, such as reduced carbon emissions and lower energy costs, are driving cities to make the transition away from fossil fuels. it is possible that tokyo's efforts will inspire other cities to do the same.
